data.title: Beautiful scenery with the lovely smell of urine in the morning.
data.text: Nice layout but it is where alot of the homeless gather.  There is also a very nice fountain/ waterfall that they like to use as their urinal.

data.title: Quiet well-kept plaza
data.text: My husband and his friend had one plan and I had another and this was the perfect spot for both plans to work. Beautiful area with lovely weather. Shady and sunny spots. Tables and benches. Local restaurants, coffee shop, art spaces. Several fountains do the street noise was blanketed by the crashing sounds of water. Lovely, all around.

data.title: Nightfall Concert Series
data.text: On Friday nights, local bands perform at Miller Park for the NIGHTFALL Concert Series. The streets are blocked. Only motorcycles can come in and park. There are food trucks. The waterfall and fountain are  a nice retreat from the loud music. Great place for people to socialize, dance, and relax. The concerts will end the last Friday in August. The concerts are free.

data.title: Only go here if there is a planned/sanctioned event.
data.text: What could be a great location in the heart of downtown Chattanooga is a blight.  It is a gathering place for the homeless and wreaks of urine.  Too bad...its quite attractive otherwise.

data.title: A fun community meeting place
data.text: This is a great place to listen to music during Nightfall or just sit and relax. It is conveniently located in the middle of town. The bathrooms are hard to get to.

data.title: One block
data.text: This is one block and there has been nothing there every time i go.  They say they do concerts and music there but i must go at off times when there is nothing there.

data.title: Free concerts in summer time
data.text: The music scene is not lacking in Chattanooga and in the warmer months you will find many outdoor free concerts available to everyone. While vendors do supply alcohol to concert goers, the scene is generally family and pet friendly. Great evening activity and walking distance to many downtown hotels.

data.title: Great Lunch Spot
data.text:
We ate lunch at the Subway in Miller Plaza and then walked around outside on a nice day. It has a well maintained landscape and multiple fountain areas. Although it's not necessarily a kids park my son enjoys walking around in the seating areas. There are 3 restaurants adjoining the park (Subway, Community Pie Pizza and Taqueria  Jalisco). A juice store called Southern Sqweeze is also in the complex. There are tables outside as well as a covered pavilion with seating. EPB provides free wi-fi.

There are plans to renovate the park and to better connect it to Miller Park which is across the street.

data.title: Nice plaza in the heart of town
data.text: A lot of activity goes on here, daytime concerts, Nightfall (a summer event after hours where they shut off the streets and have live music on stage) and many various displays in the pavilion during the daytime.  Close proximity to Porters Steakhouse, Starbucks and several other resturants right next to the venue.

data.title: A beautiful park in a beautiful city.
data.text: Miller Plaza is a free park where you can take food to eat and enjoy the outdoors. It's not really a destination point but it does have a lot of outdoor lunchtime and evening performances at its Nightfall Series during the warmer months at its outdoor amphitheatre. There is a nice waterfall fountain to provide a tranquil ambiance of sound. It's not a park really conducive for families with small children because there's not really a place for them to play, but it's a good place to take a short rest in the city. Miller Park is across MLK from the plaza that's about the same size that has a grassy area and a larger waterfall fountain.

data.title: Nice during the daytime.
data.text: Miller Plaza was one of the first parks built in the downtown area back when Chattanooga started their revitalization effort in the mid 1970s. Usually something interesting happening on the weekends but also a magnet for the homeless at night.

data.title: Free Music Venue All Summer
data.text: Locals and visitors alike flock to Miller Plaza in the summer for the Nightfall Concerts on Friday night. It is free and a great place to meet others like you and unlike you. Venders line the streets.

data.title: Clean park in middle of town
data.text: The park is most active for lunch where people go to relax and share time with friends.  There's no amenities for children.  It is an adult oriented park primarily for day use, but it hosts entertainment on summer nights or special events.

data.title: Peacefull
data.text: We have enjoyed many concerts here and as a plus saw many really cool Harley Davidson Motorcycles as well as meeting some great folks.  This is also a nice place to sit and reflect on your day, I love Chattanooga.

data.title: Great Friday Night
data.text: We came across it by accident.  We have been to downtown many times.  We had dinner one night at Mexiville and ate outside.  The music started playing and then we realized where we were.  It was the perfect location to hear the wonderful music and eat the great food also.  Perfect Friday night!

data.title: Great Venue
data.text: What a great place to sit and people watch while having a sandwich or lunch from one of the local eateries or food trucks.   There is a small fountain and waterfall in addition to many park benches.  Also an open air facility that is nice cover if raining.     In late spring thru early September, the Nightfall Concert Series begins.  This is a free concert series each Friday night that brings some incredible free music to Chattanooga.  Great bands and you can check out the line up at nightfallchattanooga.com website.

data.title: Great Park Downtown Chattanooga
data.text: Just a great place to sit and relax.  Also get a sandwich and a drink and enjoy being outside people watching!!  During the summer every Friday night there is a FREE concert in the park...great entertainment!!

data.title: Nice gem
data.text: Very nice walking destination in an interesting downtown...pleasant views around the sunset, and Chattanooga was a beautiful find in the mountains

data.title: relaxing spot
data.text: The scenery at this plaza is amazing, very relaxed if you want a nice quiet and relaxing surrounding this is the spot

data.title: Miller Plaza..Get out and walk!
data.text: If you visit this beautiful city, with all the wonderful advantages that await you, take the time to stroll Miller Plaza. It has  been a bit humid lately, however, I went today and it was delightful. A few beads of perspiration won't dampen my fun!  And the pool, well that ended my day quite refreshingly! Get out enjoy!
